node.sharedMemory

Class SMPSM

  • java.lang.Object
    • node.sharedMemory.SMPSM

  • public class SMPSM
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains statistics for all interfaces and all patterns.
    Interfaces are marked as deactivated instead of being deleted, so that the statistics aren't lost.
    The structure is List of interfaces (Interface name, List of IPs for interface (IP, List of detection events for IP of interface))
    Author:
    Parisbre56

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList<InterfaceStatistics> interfaceStatistics
      List with interfaces (interface name strings, list of events for ips)

      SMPSM()
      Creates a new statistics memory block.

      Copy constructor, makes a new copy of the statistics block.

      • interfaceStatistics

        private final java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList<InterfaceStatistics> interfaceStatistics
        List with interfaces (interface name strings, list of events for ips)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SMPSM

        public SMPSM()
        Creates a new statistics memory block.

      • SMPSM

        public SMPSM(SMPSM smpsm)
        Copy constructor, makes a new copy of the statistics block. All the data are copied, which means that they can be safely modified.
        Parameters:
        smpsm - The statistics block to be copied.

    • Method Detail

      • addInterface

        public void addInterface(org.jnetpcap.PcapIf newIf)
        Adds the interface if it doesn't exist or marks it as active if it does.
        Parameters:
        newIf - The interface to mark as active

      • removeInterface

        public void removeInterface(org.jnetpcap.PcapIf oldIf)
        Marks an interface as inactive. Does not actually delete it so that the statistics are not removed.
        Parameters:
        oldIf - The interface to mark as inactive

      • containsActivePcapIf

        public java.lang.Boolean containsActivePcapIf(org.jnetpcap.PcapIf newIf)
        Searches for an interface and checks if it is marked as active
        Parameters:
        newIf - The interface to search for
        Returns:
        True if newIf exists and is marked as active, false otherwise

      • removeNonexistentInterfaces

        public void removeNonexistentInterfaces(java.util.LinkedList<org.jnetpcap.PcapIf> newList)
        Marks all interfaces not present in the provided list as inactive. They are not actually deleted to preserve statistics
        Parameters:
        newList - The list of active interfaces

      • addIpEvent

        public void addIpEvent(StringPattern pat,
              org.jnetpcap.PcapIf currIf)
        Adds the ip detection event to memory.
        If an entry for this ip does not exist, it will be created. Else the frequency of the old entry's frequency will be incremented by one.
        Parameters:
        pat - The malicious ip
        currIf - The interface this detection occurred on

      • addStringEventCollection

        public void addStringEventCollection(java.util.LinkedList<StringPatternDetectionEvents> collection,
                            org.jnetpcap.PcapIf currIf)
        Adds a list of string patterns that had a match to this interface's statistics.
        If an event does not exist, it will be created. Else the frequeny of preexisting events will be incremented by one.
        Parameters:
        collection - A list of malicious string pattern detections to add to the interface
        currIf - The interface the capture was made on. Used to determine the Interface's current IP.

      • getInterfacesIterator

        public java.util.Iterator<InterfaceStatistics> getInterfacesIterator()
        Returns:
        An iterator over the interfaces contained in the memory
